Package io.cyborgcode.roa.framework.util

Class TestContextManager

java.lang.Object
io.cyborgcode.roa.framework.util.TestContextManager
public class TestContextManager extends Object
Manages the test execution context, providing utilities for storing and retrieving test-related data.

This class handles:

  • Retrieving and decorating the test quest context.
  • Storing test method arguments for later reference.
  • Tracking the number of parameters in test methods.

  • Method Details

    • getSuperQuest

      public static SuperQuest getSuperQuest(org.junit.jupiter.api.extension.ExtensionContext extensionContext)
      Retrieves the SuperQuest associated with the given test execution context.

      This method extracts the Quest object from the global extension context store, then decorates it using the DecoratorsFactory to return an instance of SuperQuest.

      Parameters:
      extensionContext - the JUnit extension context
      Returns:
      a SuperQuest instance containing decorated quest data
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if no Quest is found in the global store

    • storeArgument

      public static void storeArgument(SuperQuest superQuest, DataForge<?> dataForge, Object argument, org.junit.jupiter.api.extension.ExtensionContext extensionContext)
      Stores a test argument in both the SuperQuest storage and the global JUnit extension context.

      This method ensures that test arguments are persistently stored and can be retrieved later if needed. The arguments are categorized using the DataForge enumeration.

      Parameters:
      superQuest - the current SuperQuest instance managing test data
      dataForge - an enum representing the type of argument
      argument - the argument object to be stored
      extensionContext - the JUnit extension context

    • initializeParameterTracking

      public static void initializeParameterTracking(org.junit.jupiter.api.extension.ExtensionContext extensionContext)
      Initializes parameter tracking for a test method.

      This method stores the total number of parameters of the test method in the extension context. The stored value can be used for validation or further processing within the test lifecycle.

      Parameters:
      extensionContext - the JUnit extension context
